intro: Arctium minus f. pallidum, commonly known as the lesser burdock. It is a biennial plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces purple to pink flower heads that develop into spiny, bur-like fruits. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
